data.title: FAS Research Administration Services
data.text:
The federal government has prohibited the use of the social networking service TikTok and other applications from parent company ByteDance Limited on any devices used for federal contract work, including personally owned devices. This, along with warnings from federal security agencies about the IT security risks associated with connecting to these companiesâ€™ services has elevated potential risks for researchers, particularly those with federal funding.

The attached May 6, 2024, memo from John Shaw, Vice Provost for Research, addresses the steps that must be taken...

Read more about ByteDance, TikTok, and Other Entities Presenting Elevated Risks

As a reminder, the Oracle EBS 12.2 upgrade will take place from Tuesday, April 18th, at 5:00 pm through Monday April 24th, at 8:00 am. This article provides a list of the different systems affected during the upgrade as well as B2P submission due dates before the outage.

We are pleased to announce that the Faculty of Arts and Sciences (FAS), including the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences (SEAS), and the Office of the Vice Provost for Research have established a shared Research Compliance Program (RCP). Under this program, staff from the Office of the Vice Provost for Research (OVPR) will assume operational and administrative responsibility of certain research compliance functions, effective February 15, 2023. The research compliance functions to be transferred to OVPR include faculty/researcher outside...

Read more about Changes to FAS and SEAS Research Compliance
